troubleshoot_h.help1Txt: To solve a problem with the Axis product, follow the steps below:
troubleshoot_h.help2Txt1: If you suspect a problem is being caused by incorrect configuration or some other minor problem, consult the troubleshooting guide below.
troubleshoot_h.help2Txt2: It is always a good idea to check if there is an updated version of the product's firmware available. Not only do these updates include the latest improvements to the firmware, they sometimes also include new features.
troubleshoot_h.help2Txt3: New firmware releases can be obtained from the Axis Support web.
troubleshoot_h.help2Txt4: Detailed instructions on how to perform the upgrade process are provided with each new release. See also the Help on Maintenance for more information.
troubleshoot_h.help3Txt: The following list covers some of the problems that may be encountered and suggests how to remedy them:
troubleshoot_h.help4Txt: The product cannot be accessed by some clients.
troubleshoot_h.help5Txt: If using a proxy server, try disabling the proxy setting in your browser.
troubleshoot_h.help6Txt: Other networking problems. Check all cabling and connectors.
troubleshoot_h.help7Txt: The product works locally, but not externally.
troubleshoot_h.help8Txt: Check if there are firewall settings that need to be adjusted.
troubleshoot_h.help9Txt1: Check if there are router settings that need to be configured.
troubleshoot_h.help9Txt3: If using a network switch, check that the port on that device uses the same setting for the network connection type (speed/duplex) as set in the
troubleshoot_h.help10Txt: The product cannot be accessed via a host name.
troubleshoot_h.help11Txt: Check that the host name and DNS server settings are correct. See the
troubleshoot_h.helphttpslogin_answerTxt: When HTTPS is enabled, ensure that the correct protocol (HTTP or HTTPS) is used when attempting to log in. You may need to manually type in http or https in the browser's address bar.
troubleshoot_h.help8021X_answerTxt: For authentication to work properly it's important to synchronize the time in the product with an
troubleshoot_h.help13Txt: The Network indicator flashes red at short intervals.
troubleshoot_h.help14Txt: This may be due to a hardware failure. Please contact your Axis dealer.
troubleshoot_h.help15Txt: The overlay image does not display.
troubleshoot_h.help16Txt: The overlay may have been positioned incorrectly. See the help on
troubleshoot_h.helpQTresTxt1: QuickTime uses DirectX to play video by default. If DirectX is not installed on the computer no image will be seen.
troubleshoot_h.helpQTresTxt2: Install DirectX or in QuickTime, go to Edit > Preferences > QuickTime Preferences. Under the Advanced tab select Video > Safe mode(GDI only).
troubleshoot_h.help18Txt1: No image using Refresh and/or slow updating of images.
troubleshoot_h.help19Txt1: If images are very complex, try limiting the number of clients accessing the product.
troubleshoot_h.help18Txt2: Images only shown in black & white.
troubleshoot_h.help19Txt2: Check the setting for the IR cut filter. Images are shown in color only when this filter is enabled, i.e. when set to yes or auto.
troubleshoot_h.help22Txt: Check in the Video & Image > Advanced - Camera Settings that DC-Iris is set to Enabled.
troubleshoot_h.help24Txt1: Check all image and video settings. Check that there is sufficient lighting at the monitored location.
troubleshoot_h.help24Txt2: Referring to the product documentation, check the settings on the connected camera.
troubleshoot_h.help24Txt3: If available, try connecting the camera to another video server, and/or connecting a different camera.
troubleshoot_h.help25Txt: Increased lighting can often improve image quality. Check that there is sufficient lighting at the monitored location. Check all image and lighting settings.
troubleshoot_h.help26Txt: Rolling dark bands or flickering in image.
troubleshoot_h.help27Txt: Try adjusting the Flicker-free exposure setting under advanced image settings. Note: The 'Hold Current'/Manual setting may cause unwanted effects.
troubleshoot_h.help28Txt: Image too dark or too light.
troubleshoot_h.help29Txt1: Check that the termination dip switch for the video source is set to the correct position.
troubleshoot_h.help31Txt: Black borders around the video image.
troubleshoot_h.help32Txt: Adjust the X and/or Y offset, in the
troubleshoot_h.help34Txt: No image from the connected camera or no image from the Video Output.
troubleshoot_h.help35Txt: Check that correct input type has been selected in the
troubleshoot_h.help37Txt: The test image does not display as expected.
troubleshoot_h.help38Txt: Not all settings have an effect on the test image. For more information, see the help on
troubleshoot_h.help40Txt: The image frame rate in Live View is not as high as expected.
troubleshoot_h.help41Txt: Using multiple event types that use video streams (e.g. upload events
troubleshoot_h.help43Txt1: ) will cause a drop in the frame rate seen in Live View.
troubleshoot_h.help43Txt2: If using a high resolution and viewing the video stream on an older client machine, the frame rate is likely to be less than expected.
troubleshoot_h.help45Txt: There is only limited space available for the upload of your own files. Try deleting one or more existing files, to free up space.
troubleshoot_h.help47Txt: This can occur when trying to use a larger image buffer than is actually available. Try lowering the frame rate or the upload period.
troubleshoot_h.help48Txt: Problems that may be encountered when using MPEG-4 as the video format.
troubleshoot_h.help49Txt: MPEG-4 not displayed in the client.
troubleshoot_h.help51Txt: Check that the correct network interface is selected in the AMC control panel applet (network tab).
troubleshoot_h.help53Txt: In the AMC control applet, select the MPEG-4 tab and click the button Set to default MPEG-4 decoder.
troubleshoot_h.help54Txt: Multicast MPEG-4 not displayed in the client.
troubleshoot_h.help55Txt: Check with your network administrator that the multicast addresses used by the product are valid for your network.
troubleshoot_h.help52Txt: Check that the relevant MPEG-4 connection methods are enabled in the AMC control panel applet (network tab).
troubleshoot_h.help56Txt: Check with your network administrator to see if there is a firewall preventing viewing.
troubleshoot_h.help57Txt: Multicast MPG-4 only accessible by local clients.
troubleshoot_h.help58Txt: Check if your router supports multicasting, or if the router settings between the client and the server need to be configured. The TTL (Time To Live) value may need to be increased.
troubleshoot_h.help60Txt: Color depth set incorrectly on clients. Set to 16-bit or 32-bit color.
troubleshoot_h.help61Txt: If text overlays are blurred, or if there are other rendering problems, you may need to enable Advanced Video Rendering. This is done on the MPEG-4 tab in the AMC control panel applet.
troubleshoot_h.help62Txt: Ensure that your graphics card is using the latest device driver. The latest drivers can usually be downloaded from the manufacturer's web site.
troubleshoot_h.help63Txt: Color saturation is different in MPEG-4 and Motion JPEG.
troubleshoot_h.help64Txt: Modify the settings for your graphics adapter. Please see the adapter's documentation for more information.
troubleshoot_h.help109Txt: Problems that may be encountered when using the audio functionality.
troubleshoot_h.help111Txt: Too many users/clients connected to the product may affect the sound quality adversely. Try limiting the number of clients allowed to connect.
troubleshoot_h.help113Txt: It is recommended that the time setting in the product and client are synchronized with an NTP Server.
troubleshoot_h.help115Txt1: Check that the correct Audio Input source is selected.
troubleshoot_h.help115Txt2: Select Microphone for the internal microphone or for a connected external microphone. Select Line for a connected line in source.
troubleshoot_h.help117Txt: Audio break-up (stuttering audio) can be reduced using the Buffer slider control in AMC settings. A higher level will reduce audio break-up, but may introduce a noticeable lag in audio transmission.
troubleshoot_h.help65Txt: If you cannot find the help you require, please see the User's Manual, or visit the Axis Support web.
troubleshoot_h.help66Txt: The LED indicators on the product indicate the following:
troubleshoot_h.helpmicindTxt: Microphone level signal between -20 dB and -3 dB
troubleshoot_h.helpMicAmberIndTxt: Microphone level signal between -3 dB and -1 dB.
troubleshoot_h.help92Txt1: Flashes for activity on a 100 Mbps network.
troubleshoot_h.help90Txt1: Flashes for activity on a 10 Mbps network.
troubleshoot_h.helpAmber87Txt: Steady during startup, during reset to factory default or when restoring settings. Flashes while waiting to record.
troubleshoot_h.helpstat94Txt: Flashes while recording audio clips. Slow flash for failed upgrade.
troubleshoot_h.helpNetworkGdescTxt: Steady for connection to a 100 Mbit/s network. Flashes for network activity.
troubleshoot_h.helpNetworkAdescTxt: Steady for connection to a 10 Mbit/s network. Flashes for network activity.
troubleshoot_h.helpStatusAdescTxt: Steady during startup,reset to factory default or at firmware upgrade.
troubleshoot_h.help90Txt2: Flashes for activity on a 10 Mbps network.
troubleshoot_h.help92Txt2: Flashes for activity on a 100 Mbps network.
troubleshoot_h.help94Txt: Flashes rapid red for hardware error, together with the Status indicator.
troubleshoot_h.help99Txt2: Note: - the Status LED can also be configured to be unlit during normal operation, or to flash only when the camera is accessed. See also the LED Settings for more information.
troubleshoot_h.help101Txt: During reset to factory default or at firmware upgrade.
troubleshoot_h.help103Txt: Flashes rapid red for a hardware error, together with the Network indicator.

logs_h.help1Txt: This page provides more information about different types of logs that are found in this Axis product. The log files may be used for system analysis, troubleshooting purposes or whenever it is needed to contact Axis support.
logs_h.noteLogTxt: Note: Depending on your network connection, the log pages may take a while to load.
logs_h.systemLogTxt1: Provides information about system events such as product startup information, warnings and critical messages.
logs_h.accessLogTxt1: Lists all failed attempts to access the product, for example when a wrong login password is used. Note that, all authorized accesses to the product are listed in the Connection List report.
logs_h.viewServreportTxt1: Provides information about the product status in a popup window. The report includes information such as system information, user access, network configuration and parameters list.
logs_h.downloadServreportTxt1: Click to download server report. The report includes information listed in the View Server Report section. To get a snapshot of the Live View, check the Include snapshot from Live View radio button.
logs_h.paramlistTxt1: Lists the product's parameters and their current settings. This may prove useful when troubleshooting or when contacting Axis Support.
logs_h.connlistTxt1: Lists all clients that are currently accessing media streams. The report displays extra information such as date and time when the client accessed the stream, IP address that accessed the media stream and protocol used.
logs_h.crashreportTxt1: Generates an archive file with detailed information about the server's status. Crash report contains information that is in the server report as well as detailed debug information. This report may contain sensitive information such as network trace, the report may take several minutes to generate.
logs_h.readprivacystatementTxt: For more information, please read Axis Privacy statement.
